translation: Know Me as Ucchaisravas, born of nectar, among horses; Airavata among lordly elephants; and the king among men.
commentary: 10.27 Ucchaisravas? Ashwanam among horses? Viddhi know? Mam Me? Amritodbhavam born of nectar?,Airavata Airavata? among lordly elephants? among men among men? f and? Naradhipam the king.Commentary Nectar was obtained by the gods by churning the ocean of milk. Ucchaisravas is the name of the royal horse which was born in that ocean of milk when it was churned for the nectar.Airavatam The offspring of Iravati? the elephant of Indra was born at the time when the ocean of milk was churned.
